This impiles that we are already evolving rotation, because we have 
regula=
r sigmoids and negative and positive weights. Even if this is 
possible, it=
 is still very hard to evolve. I already proposed the 
possibility for NEAT=
 to discover rotation by using linear nodes and 
sine/cosine nodes, your pr=
oposal seems easier, but.. Why it it didn't 
evolve yet? 

I think the "hol=
y grail" lies somewhere else. But I hit my head in 
the wall for 2 days and=
 I can't find out anything!

Peter

> "We can actually perform any rotation as=
 two reflections by for 
example
> choosing two reflection planes going thr=
ough points
> a quarter of the angle of the rotation. The rotation will now=
 be 
performed
> in two steps, one half of the angle each. You can
> verify=
 for yourself that all the other points in the system will be 
rotated
> as=
 mush as well. "
> 
> 
> 
> The interesting thing is that, while rotation r=
equires two inputs,
> reflection can be done using one input.  Just make a =
"negative 
sigmoid"
> activation function.  Of course the negative sigmoid =
is possible by 
using
> regular sigmoid and having negative weights outgoin=
g, but it's 
easier to
> enforce if it's a new activation function.
